intro: Pasania rhabdostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed pasania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is native to certain regions of Africa and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained soils and full sun.
